title: Rename GitHub repo to llm-hayek-roth

title: DA robustness: reporting/consideration constraints
description: Improve the Roth-style DA benchmark by (i) allowing bounded preference lists (consideration sets) and (ii) charging an explicit preference-reporting attention cost, then run and document results so DA is neither artificially advantaged nor artificially constrained.
notes:
Implemented a more Roth-like DA benchmark with explicit preference-reporting constraints.

Code:
- Added DA list truncation knobs: proposer_list_k / receiver_list_k in DeferredAcceptanceParams and enforced unilateral acceptability (each side can exclude below-threshold partners): src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/mechanisms.py
- New sweep runner that treats DA attention as preference-report length (ranked partners per side) and sweeps k: src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/roth_da_sweep.py
- Make target: make roth-da (writes reports/roth_da_latest)

How attention is counted in the sweep:
- Search: proposals (+ accept decisions).
- DA: reported list entries (customers + providers); internal DA rounds are not charged.

Results (seed=7, replications=200, attention_cost=0.01, DA proposer=customer):
- Default standard baseline (standard_form_top_k=3): DA beats search once k≈10; best k=15.
  - easy: search welfare 0.261; best-k DA welfare 0.273
  - hard: search welfare 0.242; best-k DA welfare 0.264
  - AI effect is ~0 in this calibration.
  Artifacts: reports/roth_da_latest/

- Harsher standard baseline (standard_form_top_k=1): AI improves search welfare (as expected) but DA crossover remains ~k=10.
  - easy: search welfare standard 0.256 vs AI 0.261
  - hard: search welfare standard 0.237 vs AI 0.243
  - best-k DA welfare ~0.273 (easy) / ~0.265 (hard)
  Artifacts: reports/roth_da_top1_latest/

Interpretation:
- Once you charge a preference-reporting cost, DA is no longer a trivially dominant “free” clearinghouse; there is an interior k that trades off match quality vs reporting burden.
- In these primitives, elicitation improvements shift outcomes only slightly; stronger differentiation likely requires harsher baseline elicitation or more complex preference primitives.
close_reason: Implemented DA sweep with reporting-cost model; ran and documented results.

title: Make GitHub repo public
description: Flip GitHub repo visibility from private to public.
notes: Changed GitHub repo visibility to public (gh repo edit --visibility public).

title: Simulate publishable field experiment with cluster randomization
description: Add a paper-style simulation that assigns 2x2 arms at the cell level (city×category×week), computes observable acceptance-based describability proxies, and outputs regression-style tables + plots + a synthetic dataset for analysis.

title: Build simulation: two-sided market + mechanisms + metrics
description: Implement synthetic marketplace generator, preference-density proxy computation, and 2x2 arms (elicitation x mechanism) with communication costs and welfare metrics.
close_reason: Implemented synthetic two-sided market, preference-density proxy, decentralized search + centralized recommendations mechanisms.

title: Docs: add references / citations
description: Add a small References section to README that cites the in-repo paper (Shi, SSRN 3536086) and a few key related marketplace design papers mentioned there.

title: Add Roth-style deferred acceptance mechanism
description: Add a Gale–Shapley/deferred-acceptance (stable matching) mechanism for the two-sided market model; expose it as an optional central mechanism in the main 2×2 experiment; add tests.
notes:
Implemented Roth-style centralized stable matching (deferred acceptance / Gale–Shapley).

How to run:
- make experiment-da  # writes reports/latest_da/
- (or) uv run python -m econ_llm_preferences_experiment.run --out reports/latest_da --central-mechanism da

Results (seed=7, replications=200, attention_cost=0.01, proposer=customer):
- easy: match_rate_did +0.000; net_welfare_did +0.000; lambda* ~ 0.0003; net_welfare gap (central - search) ~ +0.136/customer
- hard: match_rate_did -0.001; net_welfare_did -0.001; lambda* ~ 0.0003; net_welfare gap (central - search) ~ +0.142/customer

Discussion:
- Under DA, centralization is extremely attention-light in this model (no accept decisions), so central dominates search; incremental AI effect is ~0 in this calibration.
- Treat as a Roth-style robustness/appendix benchmark vs the main recs-based central mechanism (top-k recs + max matching).

Artifacts: reports/latest_da/effects_table.csv, reports/latest_da/summary_table.csv
close_reason: Implemented deferred acceptance option + generated reports/latest_da.

title: Run experiment + generate table/plots + README report
description: Create a reproducible runner that executes the 2x2 experiment, writes a summary table and plots, and documents how to reproduce and interpret results.
close_reason: Ran 2x2 experiment and generated report table + SVG plots in reports/latest/.

title: Repo understanding: econ_llm_preferences_experiment
description: Goal: build a thorough understanding of the repo architecture, workflows (Makefile targets), and module boundaries; produce a concise map + open questions.
notes:
Repo map (econ_llm_preferences_experiment):

Entrypoints / workflow:
- Use Makefile targets (setup/check/test/llm-live/all + experiment runners).
- All runners write self-contained artifacts under reports/* (CSV/MD tables, SVG figs, README + metadata JSON).

Core Experiment 1 (2x2):
- Runner: src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/run.py
- LLM parsing/elicitation: src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/elicitation.py via parse_batch_with_gpt (OpenAIClient in openai_client.py)
- Market primitives + preference-density proxy: src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/simulation.py
- Mechanisms: src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/mechanisms.py (search, recs+matching, deferred acceptance)
- Metrics/DiD + net welfare accounting: src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/analysis.py and run.py report writer
- Plotting: src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/plotting.py (SVG output)

Other experiments:
- Congestion/saturation design: src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/experiment2_congestion.py
- FieldSim v1/v2: src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/publishable_field_sim.py, field_sim_v2.py (+ calibrate/sensitivity/intakes/heterogeneity)
- Pricing: src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/experiment5_pricing.py

Paper bundle:
- Synthetic bundle: src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/paper_bundle.py
- LLM bundle: src/econ_llm_preferences_experiment/paper_bundle_llm.py

Notes:
- Attention is counted as proposals + accept decisions, so central mechanisms differ mechanically in measured attention (e.g., DA has proposals only; recs has accept decisions).
